src:
JR東日本泡水車 8編組96節逾億美元將報廢

06 Nov 2019, 08:36

【新唐人北京時間2019年11月06日訊】颱風哈吉貝(另稱海貝思)侵襲日本造成多條河川氾濫，造成長野市赤沼的新幹線車輛中心的120節車廂泡水。因考量安全性與安定性，JR東日本公司決定報廢北陸新幹線8編組96節車箱，重新製造車廂，估算損失上看118億日圓(約1.09億美元)。
日本放送協會（NHK）報導，北陸新幹線車廂總計有10編組120節在這次千曲川氾濫中泡水，其中JR東日本公司有意報廢擁有的其中8編組96節。
JR東日本公司正在研究，報廢車廂中的部分零組件是否可以留作他用。
另外，目前減班運行的北陸新幹線，JR東日本公司希望月底時讓東京往來金澤列車班次恢復到正常水準，並在今年度結束前，讓所有列車班次恢復正常時刻表。


2019年10月13日，長野縣千曲川潰決，河岸旁邊的房屋被淹。( JIJI PRESS/JIJI PRESS/AFP via Getty Images)



2019年10月13日，颱風哈吉貝侵襲日本，千曲川潰決，長野市遭洪水淹。(STR/JIJI PRESS/AFP via Getty Images)



2019年10月13日，颱風哈吉貝侵襲日本，千曲川潰決，長野市遭洪水淹沒。(STR/JIJI PRESS/AFP via Getty Images)

(責任編輯：盧勇信)
本文網址: https://www.ntdtv.com/b5/2019/11/06/a102701172.html
text:
JR East Japan soaking water car 8 group 96 sections over 100 million US dollars will be scrapped

06 Nov 2019, 08:36

[New Tang Dynasty, Beijing time, November 06, 2019] Typhoon Hajibei (also known as Haibeisi) invaded Japan and caused a flood of rivers, causing 120 compartments of the Shinkansen Vehicle Center in Akano, Nagano. Due to the consideration of safety and stability, JR East Japan decided to scrap the 96th car of the Hokuriku Shinkansen Group 8 and re-manufacture the car. The estimated loss is 11.8 billion yen (about $109 million).
According to the Japan Broadcasting Association (NHK), the Hokuriku Shinkansen train has a total of 10 groups of 120 sections in the flood of the Chikugawa River. Among them, JR East Japan intends to scrap the possession of 8 of the 96 sections.
JR East Japan is studying whether some of the components in the scrapped car can be reserved for other uses.
In addition, the current Hokuriku Shinkansen, which is currently operating on a reduced schedule, JR East Japan hopes to return the Kanazawa trains to the normal level at the end of the month, and return all normal train schedules before the end of this year.


On October 13, 2019, the Qianqu River in Nagano Prefecture collapsed and the houses along the river bank were flooded. (JIJI PRESS/JIJI PRESS/AFP via Getty Images)



On October 13, 2019, Typhoon Haji Bay invaded Japan, and the Chiku River collapsed. The city of Nagano was flooded. (STR/JIJI PRESS/AFP via Getty Images)



On October 13, 2019, Typhoon Haji Bay invaded Japan, and Chikukawa collapsed, and Nagano City was flooded. (STR/JIJI PRESS/AFP via Getty Images)

(Editor: Lu Yongxin)
